title: How can I stop debt collection on a business loan that I am the guarantor on?
question: Hi all,
answers: Bankruptcy is one of the least expensive legal options out there. Bankruptcy can provide you great relief but before you pull the trigger it is important you sit down with a local and experienced bankruptcy lawyer. Be proactive and take us up on our free consultations.

From what you have written, it does not seem there is no reason to wait to file a bankruptcy petition. If you don't have any major assets or savings, what you own will easily fit within California exemptions.

It sounds as though a significant chunk of your debt is non-consumer, and depending on the percentage of your total debt being non-consumer, the Means Test may not be an issue at all.

Be aware that aggressive creditors will make all kinds of claims about their debt being nondischargeable, and debt buyers may even purchase some of the debts after the bankruptcy petition is filed.

If you have aggressive creditors, you should hire a bankruptcy attorney who is experienced with enforcing the Bankruptcy Stay and Discharge. The Bankruptcy Code provides methods for your attorney to be compensated by offending creditors if they violate Bankruptcy Rules.

Not all bankruptcy lawyers are aggressive about going after obnoxious creditors. Make sure that you hire an attorney who will get the initial stay order swiftly and will follow up if a creditor crosses the line.

Also you want to make sure that your lawyer will stay with you after the Order of Discharge is entered, because that's when abusive creditors come back, or send the debt to collectors who pretend to not know the debt is discharged.

I agree with my colleagues. It is now time for you to sit down with an experienced bankruptcy attorney to review your options. Relative to what you owe and the peace of mind you will receive, bankruptcy is a cheap option.
I agree with attorney Gleason above. Do yourself a favor and get a consultation with an experienced bankruptcy lawyer in your general geographic area.

If there was some sort of magic wand that a non-lawyer could waive to stop or slow existing litigation/arbitration then we would be out of business. If you think the lawyers are expensive, you will find out how expensive it is to not have one. You could file bankruptcy, and that is probably your best option. Get a free initial consultation with a local bankruptcy attorney. Your situation it typical of an honest but unfortunate debtor. That is what the bankruptcy system is for.
